body:
I would like to be able to compile an executable that works across multiple architectures. For example, our cluster contains both sandybridge and haswell nodes. In order to run a program in parallel across both, multiple architecture support must be specified at compile time. Here are some flags that do this:

| Compiler | Flag |
| --- | --- |
| Intel | -axCORE-AVX2,AVX |
| GCC | -march=haswell,sandybridge |
| PGI | -tp=haswell,sandybridge |

What's the best way to do this? I would love to integrate the new better arch support.
title: Compiling a multiple architecture executable
